document.docAuthor: Mendes, Diego Matheus De Mello, Cadena-Castañeda, Oscar J., Heleodoro, Raphael Aquino, Ramos-Pastrana, Yardany & Rafael, José Albertino
document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of chevron cricket (Orthoptera: Anostostomatidae: Lutosinae) from the Colombian and Venezuelan Amazon Rainforest

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of chevron cricket (Orthoptera: Anostostomatidae: Lutosinae) from the Colombian and Venezuelan Amazon Rainforest

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia, INPA, Programa de Pós-graduação em Entomologia.

heading.emphasis:
Tintiyakus sexangulus Mendes, Heleodoro & Ramos-Pastrana
p. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Cercus setose, conspicuously widened at anterior half, gradually narrowing at posterior half ( Fig. 1 D–F). Subgenital plate hexagonal, with basal margin straight, gradually widening at basal third of lateral margin, then gradually narrowing from medial third of lateral margin towards apical margin; apical margin emarginated by thin slit ( Fig. 1E ). Stylus slightly inward curved. Male genitalia with titillator’s process light yellow, with right longitudinal half overlapping left longitudinal half ( Figs. 2 A–B). Ejaculatory vesicles conspicuously smaller than titillator’s process ( Figs. 2 C–D).

Etymology. From Latin
sexangulus
= hexagonal, referring to the shape of the male’s subgenital plate.

Type material.
Holotype ♂ : COLOMBIA , Caquetá , Florencia , Vda. [Vereda] Las Dalias , altitude
348 m
, 01°29’24.8”N / 75°24’29.6”W ,
18.v.2012
, coleta manual em bosque secundario, Y. Ramos leg . ( LEUA )
;
Paratypes : idem , Vda. [Vereda] Aguas Negras , 01°40’30.06”N / 75°36’8.59”W ,
370 m
,
04.iv.2013
, coleta manual em bosque secundario, Y. Ramos leg. ( 1♀ – INPA )
;
idem ,
27.iv.2012
( 1♂ – INPA )
;
idem , Vda. [Vereda] El Limón , Finca El Limón , 01°22’24.3”N / 75°36’36.6”W ,
643 m
,
30.ix.2015
, coleta manual em bosque secundário, Y. Ramos leg . ( 1♀ – LEUA )
.

Male. Head. Fastigium of vertex frontally projected, subtrapezoidal with apical margin emarginated, thinner than scapus ( Fig. 1B ). Fastigium of frons inconspicuous. Frons with light yellow and light brown spots ( Fig. 1C ). Clypeus subtriangular, with conspicuous medial emargination at basal margin; lateral margin gradually narrowing towards apical margin, slightly curved; apical margin arched ( Fig. 1C ). Labrum asymmetrical, subtriangular ( Fig 1. C ). Antenna light brown, antenna partially broken; scapus 1.4 times larger than pedicel. Compound eye oval, light brown with black spots (dry) ( Fig. 1 A–C). Mandibular palpus long, approximately 1.3 times shorter than posterior tibia; last mandibular palpomere rounded, 3.2 times shorter than penultimate mandibular palpomere ( Fig. 1 A–C). Maxillary palpus at least three times shorter than mandibular palpus.

Legs. Fore tibia with one dorsoposterior spine, five ventroanterior and two ventroposterior spines ( Figs. 1 A–B). Mid tibia with three dorsoanterior, four ventroanterior, three dorsoposterior and 5 ventroposterior spines ( Fig. 1 A– B). Hind femur posteriorly with 13 chevron ridges ( Fig. 1A ).

Abdomen . Cercus setose, conspicuously widened at anterior half, gradually narrowing at posterior half ( Fig. 1 D–F). Subgenital plate hexagonal, with straight basal margin; gradually widening at basal third of lateral margin, then gradually narrowing from medial third of lateral margin towards apical margin; apical margin emarginated by thin slit ( Fig. 1E ). Stylus cylindrical, slightly inward curved, with rounded apex ( Fig. 1 D–F).

Genitalia . Dorsally with anterior margin conspicuously projected ( Fig. 2 A–D); titillator’s process light yellow, with right longitudinal half overlapping left longitudinal half ( Fig. 2 A–B). Ejaculatory vesicles ellipticals, conspicuously smaller than titillator’s process ( Fig. 2 C–D).
Coloration . Described based on dry specimen ( Fig. 1 A–B). Anterior portion of the body dark brown, posterior portion light brown.
Female. Like the male ( Fig 3 A–E), except for:
Nymph. Older nymphs are very similar to adults, differing by the lighter coloration and by the not fully developed terminalia.

Measurements (mm). TL: male 29 / female 33–30,2; WF: male 5,7 / female 5,3; PL: male 7,8 / female 9,5–9,2; PH : male 5,6 / female 5,7–5,5; FF: male 10,2 / female 14–10,4: FT: male 11,4 / female 12–11,3; MF: male 10,5 / female 14–11,7: MT: male 13,5 / female 14–13,7; HF: male 25,4 / female 29,7–26,1; HT: male 23,5 / female 27,3–24,7; PL: male 5,3 / female 3,7–3,5; LC: male 3,9 / female 3,2–3; OL: 15,3–13,2.
